snippet: Researchers also reported that the soldiers who were at highest risk of making a suicide attempt often had a long history of impulsive anger.
abstract: Research contained in three papers posted online by journal JAMA Psychiatry finds that most of Army's enlisted men and women with suicidal tendencies had them before they enlisted; researchers also report that soldiers who were at highest risk of making suicide attempts often have long history of impulsive anger.
lead_paragraph: Researchers also reported that the soldiers who were at highest risk of making a suicide attempt often had a long history of impulsive anger.

headline.main: Suicidal Tendencies Are Evident Before Deployment, Study Finds
headline.print_headline: Suicidal Tendencies Are Evident Before Deployment, Study Finds
